mesquite.lib.characters

Interface MCharactersStatesHolder

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Listable, Renamable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    MAdjustableDistribution, MCharactersDistribution, MCharactersHistory
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MCategoricalAdjustable, MCategoricalDistribution, MCategoricalEmbedded, MCategoricalHistory, MCategoricalStates, MCharactersStates, MContinuousAdjustable, MContinuousDistribution, MContinuousEmbedded, MContinuousHistory, MContinuousStates, MDNAAdjustable, MDNAEmbedded, MDNAHistory, MGeographicStates, MMeristicAdjustable, MMeristicDistribution, MMeristicEmbedded, MMeristicHistory, MMeristicStates, MProteinAdjustable, MProteinEmbedded, MProteinHistory

    public interface MCharactersStatesHolder
extends Listable, Renamable
    Stores the character states for multiple characters at a series of terminal taxa or nodes in a tree. The class on which both MCharactersDistribution and MCharactersHistory are based. See general discussion of character storage classes under CharacterState

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Class getCharacterDataClass()
      returns the corresponding CharacterData subclass
      CharacterState getCharacterState(CharacterState cs, int ic, int it)
      get CharacterState of character ic at node or taxon it
      java.lang.String getDataTypeName()
      Returns the type of data stored.
      int getNumChars() 
      int getNumNodes()
      returns number of nodes for which MCharactersStates is defined (either terminal taxa, if MCharactersDistribution, or all nodes in tree, if MCharactersHistory)
      int getNumTaxa()
      returns number of terminal taxa for which MCharactersStates is defined
      CharacterData getParentData()
      Returns the parent CharacterData
      java.lang.Class getStateClass()
      returns the corresponding CharacterState subclass
      Taxa getTaxa()
      Returns the Taxa to which this applies
      boolean isCurrentlyIncluded(int ic)
      Returns whether character ic is currently included
